title: Rabdan Academy to Host Policing and Security Conference Next Month
text: Monday, October 12, 2015 4:53PM IST (11:23AM GMT) Rabdan Academy to Host Policing and Security Conference Next Month ‘Global Challenges and Local Solutions’ Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates Under the patronage of Lt. General HH Sheikh Saif bin Zayed Al Nahyan, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior, Rabdan Academy will host the Policing and Security Conference in collaboration with the Ministry of Interior and Charles Sturt University, Australia. The two-day Conference will be held on November 4-5 at the Abu Dhabi National Exhibitions Centre (ADNEC) under the theme ‘Global Challenges and Local Solutions’. In highlighting the significance of the Conference, Dr. Faisal Obaid Al Ayyan, Executive Vice President of Rabdan Academy, said that the Policing and Security Conference will tackle contemporary issues in security and policing education, training and research. “The Conference focuses on the means of integrating and making effective use of technology in security and policing institutions,” he added. According to Dr. Al Ayyan, “The key objectives of the conference include exchanging expertise; facilitating the use of cutting-edge technology and modern approaches to security and policing; and building partnerships to enhance the efficiency of security and law enforcement personnel.” The Conference brings together a wide range of international and regional experts in policing and security, with selectively featured speakers to address the latest policing developments and innovations in the UAE, the GCC, and worldwide. The Conference’s program will include sessions addressing various aspects of policing and security. Concurrent sessions will be run to deliver academic papers in the same key areas. The conference schedule will be divided into four key session areas, with keynote speakers from across the world providing their knowledge, expertise and insights into current and future challenges in policing and security.
